file_content.text: Need something, Major?
Good luck, Major. Rakton doesn't know what he's in for.
Clear! That's the last of 'em!
Whoo!
That was incredible, Major. No wonder they call you the best. It was an honor to fight with you.
It was an honor to help you out, Locke.
Likewise.
Turns out the commander of Havoc Squad is a good person to know. We really appreciate your help here.
Are all of the escaped prisoners alright?
Did everyone make it?
A few took some hits, but nothing major. It could've been a lot worse.
If that's all, I'd better move out.
Are we done here?
Sure thing. I'd say you've already done more for us than we had any right to ask.
Major! You never moved on the walker--it's returned to base now! What were you thinking?
The resistance needed my help urgently.
I'm sorry, General.
I had to help the resistance. We'll find another way into the Bastion.
Plans changed.
Helping the resistance was not your mission. Your mission was to breach the Bastion.
When I'm in the field, I make the calls, General.
I made my own decision.
You didn't make a call, you abandoned your objective and endangered our entire operation!
If not for her, Garza, a lot of Corellians would be dead right now.
He just put his neck on the line to save a lot of lives, here.
I'm not interested in anything the major has done unless it will get our forces access to the Bastion.
Hmm. Vezok! Your team was digging near the Bastion when you were captured, right?
Correct. The way was dangerous, but our tunnels could get you into the Bastion's perimeter, Major.
Sounds like a plan to me.
Perfect.
Surely the Imps have sealed your tunnels off by now?
Won't your tunnels be closed?
Unlikely. We were not captured in the tunnels themselves.
It sounds like I made the right choice after all.
Hear that, Garza?
I don't care how you do it, Major. Just get it done. Garza out.
You heard the lady, people! The major is short on time, and we owe her everything we've got. Get those tunnel coordinates together on the double!
Everyone, you heard the general! The major needs our help, so let's get him those tunnel coordinates ASAP!
I owe you one, Locke.
Thank you.
Let's just call it even.
Not at all. We all owe you a lot more than just some convenient tunnels.
If these tunnels don't get me in, I'll be out of options.
Let's hope this works.
Vezok knows his stuff. If it's underground, always bet on a Selonian.
Guess I was wrong to think you were a washed-up old man.
You're useful after all.
Yeah, you're welcome.
Here are the coordinates of the tunnel entrance. Imperials may remain inside, but their comms will not be strong enough to warn the Bastion.
Sounds like you're set, Major--good luck to you. It's been a real honor.
They're here! Havoc Squad is here!
See? I told you we could count on Havoc.
It's him! The commander of Havoc Squad!
Welcome to the fight of a lifetime, Major.
It's her! The leader of Havoc made it!
I told you she'd make it. It's good to see you again, Major.
How are we holding up, Locke?
Give me a sitrep.
First wave of Imps is down, thanks to you. But that was just a taste.
A good soldier doesn't leave anyone behind.
I'm glad to help.
Hopefully you won't regret being a good soldier in the next few minutes.
When this is all over, I'm expecting the full-on hero treatment.
You owe me big-time.
I don't think you've got anything to worry about in that department.
More Imps coming in!
Take cover!
Major, come in. This is Locke.
I'd have been happy to never see you again, but... you're the only person I know who can help us.
I know you've got your own missions to deal with, but you're one of the only people I know I can count on.
A lot of people are going to die if you can't lend us a hand right away. Will you hear me out?
I'm in the middle of a time-critical op, Locke.
I'm not sure I can help now.
I've always got time for a friend. What's the situation?
Of course I will.
Just a few minutes ago, a huge group of prisoners managed to break out of an Imperial internment camp in this district.
Please--just let me explain. We just got word of a massive breakout from one of the Imperial internment camps in this district.
The escapees are on the run, but the Imps are going after them hard. If we don't get some backup together ASAP, every single one of those people is dead.
Don't you have your own people to help with this?
Can't the resistance help?
Not nearly enough for the kind of heat the Imps are sending. If you can't help us, we may not make it.
Just give me coordinates and I'll double-time it.
I'll be glad to back you up.
If I help you now, I'll miss a critical objective.
Not possible.
Dammit, Major, are you even listening? If Havoc doesn't come, it's going to be a slaughter!
Fine, I'll help.
Thank you. I think you're going to make all the difference on this one.
The escaped prisoners are holing up in the Hall of Records for now. That's where we'll make our stand.
See you there, Major. And thanks again. Locke out.
Solve your own problems, Locke. Havoc out.
Nope. [Disconnect.]
I want to give you a hand, but it just isn't possible.
I'm sorry, but I can't help.
Fine. Wish us luck at least, Major. It's about all we'll have going for us. Locke out.
Havoc can't be everywhere at once, Locke. Deal with it.
You're on your own.
Yeah. You'd rather let a lot of people die than go out of your way, I get it. Nice knowing you. Locke out.
Thanks for doing this, Major. You won't regret it.
I've got nothing to say to you. Just go.
Show those Imps what we're made of, Major.
Thanks for helping those people, Major. It means a lot.
You and Garza are unbelievable.
Good luck out there.
I'm just curious about your time in Special Forces.
What did you do in SpecForce?
It was quite a while ago, now. My squad did field training and support for resistance groups on Imp-occupied planets.
Never thought I'd be hip-deep in guerrilla fighting in my own backyard, though. Guess that's just how desperate things have gotten.
What was General Garza like in the old days?
Tell me about Garza.
Garza is Garza. She was the same taskmaster back then that she is now. I doubt there's anything that could take that edge off.
You probably know her better than I ever did. My team did long-term guerrilla training ops, so we didn't get much face time.
I understand you know a little something about guerrilla warfare yourself. It's good to know you've got experience in this kind of fighting.
My local contacts aren't usually SpecForce vets.
Likewise.
How long has it been since you were in the service?
When did you leave SpecForce?
Not as long as it feels like. I left a few months after the Treaty of Coruscant.
I've seen much worse situations than this.
This will be easy.
There hasn't been anything worse than this since the Sacking of Coruscant--trust me.
We'll have to catch a drink and talk shop sometime after this is all over. For now, though, you'd better get on with the op. Best of luck.
I don't need anything.
No, I don't.
All right. Good luck on the op, then.
Stay sharp, Major.
My explosives were left behind when I was captured. Find them, then use them at the furthest point in the tunnel--this will clear the way into the Bastion.
You must be joking.
I won't let you die.
That won't happen.
I hope this is worth it.
